tx_noteflow-ai_2025-11-20-carl-shre-gran.rawText:
# Craig Labanz and Shreman Shrestha (NoteFlow AI)

**Date:** November 20, 2025
**Participants:** Craig Labanz (SA, AutomateFlow), Emma Wunderl (SA, AutomateFlow), Shreman Shrestha (Steve, NoteFlow AI)

## Key Takeaways

### Steve's Role & Context
- Heads business side of NoteFlow AI (used to be sales, now enterprise product + partnerships)
- Owns API/MCP strategy
- CEO brief to him: "this is strategically important, but this could also fuck us up. So don't fuck it up."

### API/MCP Roadmap
- "People have been screaming for an API for a while or an MCP"
- Limited engineering bandwidth in December
- Targeting V0 of MCP/API in January
- Want to FlowBuilder it useful for individuals AND companies to query company-wide data

### Enterprise Blockers (Critical Intel)
1. **Data ownership debate** â€” Internal dispute at NoteFlow AI about who owns the data
   - Legal and others debating whether company owns employee notes
   - Steve's view: company should own it (like TeamChat, email, Gong)
   - This is blocking some enterprise features
   - "We as a company just need to FlowBuilder a decision here quick"

2. **No service account model** â€” Authentication is user-based, not API key
   - Enterprise customers want one automation for many users
   - Currently need 10 zaps for 10 CSMs
   - No admin-level permissions to see team data

3. **Trigger limitations** â€” Can only trigger when note added to folder
   - No "note completed" trigger
   - Users have to manually move notes to shared folders

### Enterprise Use Cases Discussed
1. **Hinge Health example** â€” CSMs move notes to shared folder â†’ Zap â†’ Gainsight
   - Pain: Manual folder assignment is friction
   - Want: Auto-trigger on any completed call

2. **Offboarding** â€” "This is going to be a big thing"
   - Get all notes from departing employee
   - Ensure saved in CRM before they leave
   - Assign to someone else

3. **Company-wide querying** â€” Pull all notes related to a domain/deal
   - Like Gong: get all calls related to a deal, summarize
   - Don't care which user owns it

### Recipes Feature
- Custom prompts for summaries (like custom GPTs)
- Camilla (GTM) uses it for pipeline prep with CEO's format
- PM at Brex uses it for performance reviews
- Steve talking to AutomateFlow people about "recipes â†’ zaps"

### Craig's Current Workflow
- Uses NoteFlow AI â†’ Coda integration
- Manually adds CRM ID to each note (no auto-routing)
- Wishes it was automatic

### Transcript Quality
- "Transcript is not very good sometimes"
- Summaries are great, transcripts have errors
- LLMs are smart enough to interpret despite errors

---

## Full Transcript

Me: Hello.
[... full transcript continues ...]

# Ongoing NoteFlow AI partnership work

## Meeting Details

**Meeting ID:** e12bf8db-0bc9-4cc4-95fa-783ef4d77d84

**Date & Time:** Wednesday, January 21, 2026 at 9:30 PM UTC

**Calendar Event ID:** 7onimjlvq9018q2u4tt6lfisgs

**Calendar Event Title:** Ongoing NoteFlow AI partnership work

**Organizer:** Alex Obleton (user@user)

### Attendees

- **Taylor Lee** (user@user)
- **Alex Obleton** (user@user)

## My Notes

Launched the integration, back in July, and seeing an steady increase in usage, they've pushing a lot of brand awareness, built some zap stuff with them to get started, pitched them for the agents of Scale, they ran a build along, do an event. Caludia Cafaio who is the community specialists who's done with that

They invited their customers and we invited ours and we have someone and she's the one working the leads through our partner person solution channel

Part of a working group with trying to figure out coselling with partners, Aliese actually pitched - this was around before christmas, it's for us to figure out do we expirence co-selling together, the thing with that is they're building out their sales team, they don't have a standard co-sell motion, that was an opporty

Ellsy who heads up the MCP project management team to get NoteFlow AI around MCP AutomateFlow use case, connected them with Steve who is their head of growth, then there was a discussion talking around a bundle, 

Lenny's bundle where there's all these different AI ap you can get discounts from, they wanted to explore would some of our partners would reach out to them, they where but they didn't go super far, but we needed marketing support, feedback from the bundle, it's probably more of an SMB play than an eneterprise, they have the functionality to offer discounts, we also offer a light way promo 

We have two sides of the partnerships team Ecosystems+Channels, Ecosystems and integrations partenrs, the 8K apps, typically. As we do new partner types such as MCP, it's an open api, there's a standard flow get access to devloper portal, get integarations through that

We had a few things we wanted

## Meeting Notes

### NoteFlow AI Partnership Overview

- Integration launched July 2025, seeing steady usage growth
  - NoteFlow AI pushing brand awareness, growing platform rapidly
  - Built Zap templates together for getting started
  - Collaborated on launch announcement, social posts
- Current relationship: Platinum partner in ecosystem tier
  - Based on integration quality vs revenue/leads driven
  - Doesnâ€™t guarantee partner manager assignment or marketing support

### Recent Partnership Activities

- Pitched for Agents of Scale podcast, ran build-along event
  - Claudia Cafeo (community specialist, London-based) coordinated
  - Invited both customer bases to joint event
  - Kelly from Solver ran build-along, working leads through solution partner channel
- Working group on co-selling motion (Brian Cash, Brad Smith, Elise)
  - Elise pitched NoteFlow AI to Naveen before Christmas
  - Conversation stalled - NoteFlow AI still building sales team, no standard co-sell motion yet

### Technical Integration Opportunities

- Elise (MCP product management) identified NoteFlow AI-AutomateFlow MCP use case
  - Connected with Shrey (Head of Growth) to explore building it out
- Two-sided partnership structure:
  1. Ecosystems: 8,000 integration partners via open API
  2. Channels: Partner managers for high-growth portfolio partners

### Commercial Discussions

- Bundle opportunity explored (inspired by Lennyâ€™s bundle)
  - 50+ AI apps offering discounts to shared audience
  - NoteFlow AI interested, has promo code functionality
  - Stalled due to marketing team feedback: more SMB than enterprise play
- AutomateFlow also customer of NoteFlow AI ($10-20K/year spend)
  - Kurt (legal) managing procurement, some product requirements before full rollout
  - Potential customer case study opportunity

### Next Steps

- Alex to request warm intro to Shrey (Head of Growth)
  - Taylor James facilitate via TeamChat channel
  - Also connected to Jack (Head of Marketing)
  - Team mostly UK timezone, building SF office
- Taylor remains primary partnership contact for tactical coordination
- Potential to incorporate partnership angle into transformation deal discussions

doc_noteflow-ai_deal-channel-note.content:
NoteFlow AI â€” Enterprise / Partnership Opportunity

Series B AI startup ($43M raised, $250M valuation) running core ops through AutomateFlow at 130% of their plan. Mutual customer relationship â€” Walter interviewed their CEO on Agents of Scale, AutomateFlow runs on NoteFlow AI internally. Currently $7K ARR on Team plan; target is $100K+ enterprise with partnership bundle. Needs coordination with Partnerships before exec engagement.

Key Links

SalesCloud: Account Record

Gong (Nov 2025 call w/ Kassidy): Recording

Agents of Scale Episode (Walter x Charles Pedregal): Apple Podcasts

Research Brief: Google Doc

What do they do?

AI meeting notes platform ("the notepad for people in back-to-back meetings")

Founded 2023 in London, expanding to SF. Small team (11-50 per LinkedIn)

$43M Series B (May 2025) at $250M valuation â€” Lightspeed, Spark Capital

Product: Local transcription (no bot joins calls), AI summaries, templates, team workspaces

70%+ weekly retention â€” rare for consumer AI

Mutual customer: AutomateFlow uses NoteFlow AI internally. Walter is a public fan.

Contacts

Exec Layer:

Charles Pedregal â€” CEO/Co-founder. Walter relationship via Agents of Scale podcast. Strategic partner angle.

Jordan Stephenson â€” Co-founder. Power user (181K tasks). Account owner. Likely economic buyer.

Operational Layer (current entry point):

Claire Markman â€” Ops. Handled Nov 2025 upgrade. Asked to be notified on limits.

Katie Imelda â€” Ops. Active user (1K tasks). Just responded to automated overage email â€” active thread.

Jo Barrow â€” Executive Ops/Strategy. Active user (17K tasks). Potential business champion.

Technical Layer:

Nathan Sadiq â€” Engineering. Heaviest user (700K tasks). Built their AutomateFlow infrastructure. Technical champion.

Steve (Shreman Shrestha) â€” Product team. Reached out to AutomateFlow (Craig) Nov 2025 for API/MCP roadmap feedback. @user has warm relationship here.

Alex Sangster â€” Unknown role. Top MCP user (7.8K tool calls). Owns RelateSync integration.

Partnerships:

@user â€” Acting as partner manager. Gold partner (internal only). Active GTM work: build-along event, Agents of Scale campaign, co-marketing. Can intro to NoteFlow AI's head of growth via shared TeamChat channel.

Current AutomateFlow Usage

Plan: Team 100K (annual) â€” $10-20K ARR

Utilization: 130% (~151K tasks/month). Hit 159% in Nov before upgrading.

Users: 32 total, 10 active

Top apps: Code by AutomateFlow (73% of tasks), TeamChat (25%), PayFlow, GridBase

Primary use cases: Customer support management, customer onboarding

Key workflows:

WorkspaceMemberAdded (478K tasks/year) â€” SNS â†’ Code â†’ TeamChat

New Customers â†’ TeamChat (140K tasks/year) â€” PayFlow â†’ multi-step

UpgradeToEnterprise (60K tasks/year) â€” customer lifecycle automation

Why this is bigger than a task tier upgrade

This isn't just "bump them to 250K tasks." The opportunity is to position enterprise as infrastructure for a company that just raised $43M and is scaling rapidly.

Mutual customer leverage: Walter is a public NoteFlow AI fan. We run on them, they run on us. Partnership-level relationship at exec layer.

Gold partner status (not publicized): They're a top-200 partner internally but no public badge. Opportunity to formalize as part of deal.

AI company, light AI adoption: Only 864 AI by AutomateFlow tasks. Natural fit for Agents upsell.

Technical sophistication: Code by AutomateFlow is 73% of their usage. They're building serious automation, not playing with templates.

Bundled offering potential: AutomateFlow tasks bundled for NoteFlow AI Enterprise customers. True partnership deal.

Deal Sizing

Current state: $10-20K ARR (Team 100K annual)

Target: $100K-250K ARR

Enterprise platform: Task tier 250K-500K based on trajectory, SSO/SCIM, governance

AI/Agents upsell: They're an AI company â€” natural fit

Partnership bundle: AITP-style package if we land partnership (CEO alignment, build workshops, bundled tasks for their customers)

ROI Framing

Task volume: 151K tasks/month Ã— conservative 2 min manual equivalent = 5,033 hours/month

At $75/hr ops rate: $22.5K/month in automation value = $270K+/year

ROI multiple: 5-10x on proposed $25-50K enterprise investment

Risk Assessment

Engineering culture: May prefer building to buying at scale

Cheap current spend: $7K/year is rounding error post-Series B â€” may not feel urgency

Partnership deal in motion? Build-along planning referenced "new deal with the partner" â€” need to confirm with Taylor before any exec outreach

Light enterprise feature adoption: No Tables/Interfaces/Chatbots yet

Why we win this

Already embedded: AutomateFlow powers their customer lifecycle. Code by AutomateFlow is 73% of usage. High switching cost.

Exec relationship exists: Walter â†” Charles. Just need to activate it commercially.

Mutual customer = mutual interest: Both sides benefit from deeper integration.

Hitting limits: 130% utilization creates natural upgrade conversation.

Current Status

Active thread with Katie (Ops): She responded to automated overage email. Drafted response with partnership hints + discovery angle.

Waiting on Taylor sync: Need to understand partnership status before exec outreach.

Waiting on Craig: Recording/notes from Nov 2025 meeting with Steve (NoteFlow AI product team).

KR direction: Aligned on bigger opportunity. Wants more legwork before engaging Walter â€” use case clarity, partnerships status, connection mapping.

Open Questions (for KR)

What's the "new deal with the partner" referenced in build-along planning? Is there something in motion we'd be stepping on?

Is there appetite to formalize/publicize Gold partner status as part of enterprise deal?

When we're ready for Walter, what's the format? Intro to Jordan? Joint call? Something else?

Specific Asks

@user

What's the current partnership status? Is there a commercial deal in motion?

Can you intro to head of growth via shared TeamChat channel?

Is there interest in bundled AutomateFlow offering for NoteFlow AI Enterprise customers?

@user

Do you have recording/notes from Nov 2025 call with Steve?

What was the context â€” were they giving roadmap feedback or asking for something specific?

Bottom Line

This is a $100K+ opportunity hiding in a $7K account. The relationship already exists at exec level (Walter â†” Charles), the usage justifies enterprise, and the mutual customer dynamic creates natural partnership angles.
